intro: Virgulus adnatus, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Virgulus adnatus produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
